intro: Kolobopetalum exauriculatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed kolobopetalum, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
